intro: Uragoga pleiocephala, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its large, white, nocturnal blooms that open at night and close by dawn. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its fragrant, tubular flowers. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in fine hairs. Uragoga pleiocephala is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
